intro: Cyanea rollandioides, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsules as its fruit. Cyanea rollandioides plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
